muchart 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Generate random samples from the gamma distribution

    r_g.Rd

    This function generates random samples from the gamma distribution.

    Usage

    r_g(lots, n, mu, k, ...)

    Arguments

    lots

    The number of lots

    n

    The sample size

    mu

    The mean of the gamma distribution

    k

    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution

    ...

    Additional arguments to be passed to rgamma() from the stats package

    Value

    A matrix of random samples

    Examples

    r_g(lots = 5, n = 10, mu = 5, k = 2)
#>               n_1      n_2       n_3      n_4      n_5      n_6      n_7
#> sample_1 2.320658 7.037769 2.9233501 1.727954 5.800363 6.663315 2.770254
#> sample_2 1.824857 2.099448 0.1621112 5.454093 2.161466 9.307297 4.372371
#> sample_3 6.415140 1.931157 4.2839524 3.989551 5.858729 1.120084 5.592537
#> sample_4 9.895865 2.875760 0.7168222 7.096748 3.552616 2.696860 5.229762
#> sample_5 3.747752 4.818014 3.7172832 9.400211 1.688691 7.549790 2.440662
#>               n_8      n_9     n_10
#> sample_1 1.421609 2.976369 4.674236
#> sample_2 3.300920 3.999653 8.184296
#> sample_3 7.464164 3.049246 1.944401
#> sample_4 4.414989 4.524555 4.867846
#> sample_5 2.652433 3.438952 1.171964
r_g(lots = 10, n = 20, mu = 10, k = 3)
